alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 4:30PM EST until February 23 at 4:05AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST/8 PM EST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois and northwest Indiana, including the following areas, in Illinois, Ford, Grundy, Iroquois, Kankakee, La Salle, Livingston and Will. In northwest Indiana, Benton, Jasper and Newton. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CST /800 PM EST/. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Poor drainage areas and fields may flood. Slow moving or standing water will continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 PM CST /424 PM EST/, doppler radar and automated rain gauges continued to indicate heavy rainfall of 0.5 to 2.5 inches in the advisory area. The heaviest rainfall has occurred along and near a line from Gibson City to Loda to Milford. - Additional waves of rainfall are moving into the area, which may produce amounts up to 2 inches. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kankakee, Bourbonnais, Bradley, Streator, Pontiac, Manteno, Rensselaer, Watseka, Paxton, Dwight, DeMotte, Fairbury, Gibson City, Momence, Fowler, Gilman, Kentland, Herscher, Clifton and Milford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
